title: WCAS MATH 311-1-51 MENU:  Probability and Stochastic Processes

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Probability and Stochastic Processes is three-quarter sequence in probability and stochastic processes requiring background in calculus but not measure theory. The first quarter is a careful introduction to probability spaces, random variables, independence, distributions, and generating functions culminating in the Central Limit Theorem. The second and third quarters largely concern stochastic processes, including Markov chains, stationary processes, martingales, and diffusion processes. This sequence covers more topics at a faster pace, and in greater depth than 310-1,2,3.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Students should have completed one of the first-year MENU sequences or an equivalent.
Prior or concurrent enrollment in real analysis may be helpful.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
ISBN: 978-0486466286
Basic Probability Theory
Robert B Ash
Dover

Free e-text available at: http://www.math.uiuc.edu/~r-ash/BPT.html

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Students may not receive credit for both 311-1 and any of 314, 383, 385, EECS 302, IEMS 202, or STAT 320-1. Students may not receive credit for both 311-2 and 310-2 or both 311-3 and 310-3.

subject: MATH
